text: Had a short stay here in January with my wife. Rooms are beautiful and the service was fantastic...kinda felt like you were visiting friends ! After a night out we were welcomed back and shared a bottle of wine (or two!) with the owner and a couple of his friends and a couple of guests ! Just excellent. Would certainly recommend !
title: “Fantastic !”

text: We arrived for one nights stay on Easter Saturday to a very warm and friendly greeting by Anita. We were offered a choice of rooms as there was 2 available and chose the one on the top floor with a four poster bed. Wow what a fabulous room!!! In fact the whole house is beautiful, and is furnished to a very high standard with some wonderful antiques. Later my nephew who lives nearby called in to see if we had arrived ok. Anita came to our room to inform us that we had a visitor and then she promptly made a pot of tea for us all which was brought to us in longe. Later that evening I popped downstairs to see if they had a number for a local taxi and was told that if we came down when we were ready Anita would call one and we could have a glass of wine whilst we were waiting. Breakfast was fantastic and the overall service could not have been better. I would definitely recommend this guesthouse and will almost certainly visit again when I'm next in the area. Room Tip: All rooms are lovely See more room tips
title: “Superb Guesthouse”

text: We were booked in to Nutters for my 50th birthday celebration, so my wife was looking for a convenient hotel. She booked The Villas Residence for one night & it was absolutely the right decision. We were met by the owner, Paul, who greeted us & looked after us more like family than paying guests. As we were the first guests to arrive on the Saturday afternoon so Paul showed us around the rooms and let us make the choice. We chose the Victorian room, which overlooked he front gardens. It was a good size, well furnished with great light. It's not en suite but the bathroom which is right next door is beautifully & expensively equipped so it's no hardship at all. My wife had a great soak in the Jacuzzi bath as we prepared to go out for dinner. Before we left the hotel for Nutters, we had a very pleasant glass of wine with the other guests in the very comfortable sitting room. Overnight, we had a great sleep in the huge, ornate bed. The linen was possibly the crispest I've ever slept in and made for a very comfortable night. Breakfast, the next morning, was made to order and was most excellent. The staff were polite, discreet, interested & attentive & nothing was too much trouble. Overall, this was a great experience & we would not hesitate to return or recommend it to others. Congratulations to Paul & his team for creating an oasis of tranquility & refinement in an increasingly hectic world. title: “09 March '13 - The Victorian Room”

text: It's not just how ace the villa's is, Paul is a legend! We arrived on a Saturday. There was a power cut as workmen had cut cables on main road! Didn't matter though. Spent late afternoon in candle light with Paul and guests, chatting, drinking wine, relaxing, having a laugh. Rooms amazing. Host, very cool. Breakfast, probably the best I've eaten! The place rocks. I'm a Brighton lad, I'm quite cosmopolitan. Only came up North to pick up some new wheels for my motor! Me and my missus will be coming back. Thanks Paul. Thanks for the wonderful experience!
title: “I want to live here!”

text: A wonderful hotel/guest house. Furnished with great skill, mixing modern amenities with charming antiques. Warm, welcoming, very country-house traditional with great hospitality from both the manager and staff. Excellent breakfast with some of the best home-made marmalade I have ever tasted. Cannot recommend highly enough. Top-spec bathroom is next door (so not quite en-suite) although fluffy bathrobes were provided so no worries on that front! I cannot think of a thing they could do to make this better - superb in every way.
title: “What a find!”

text: This really is an amazing hotel. Very small. intimate. Rooms are like an Aladdin's cave. So unique. Great furnishings. Antiques everywhere. So warm. So welcoming. I don't think I have come across rooms of this high standard anywhere. Real attention to detail. This is a real hidden gem. I am amazed at the price. Unbelievable value for money. The host/manager cannot do enough for you.Shared a glass of wine with him and had a good chat. Every hotel should be like this. This really does set the standard for others to follow. Blown away by my experience. Town centre just a couple of minutes walk but you feel like you are in the middle of nowhere. If money was no object, this is how I would have my house. Love it. Will be back time and time again. If you need a hotel in Rochdale, honestly, don't look any further. Tried the rest. This is head and shoulders above the rest. Room Tip: All amazing and truly unique. title: “One of the most stunning places to stay”

text: We stayed here on Saturday after having a very relaxing massage at 'The Little Day spa' in Cutgate (highly recommended) for a well-deserved overnight break from our 7 month old baby. The house is a fantastically well converted period property with spacious rooms, high ceilings and endless original features. It's been very stylishly but sympathetically decorated with some lovely pieces and lots of well-placed details in each room. This gives it a classy show home, or magazine shoot feel, but without any pretension - still a very relaxing place despite having a sense of occasion. There are 6 bespoke rooms, each with its own unique style; we stayed in the front room that has a Chinese/Asian theme, and came with lots of interesting antiquities and pieces to admire. Our room was en-suite with a large and super comfy bed and lovely duvet and pillows. We also had the option to take the room in the attic which had a beautiful antique four poster bed and its own bathroom with a very nice roll-top bath. The owner Paul was very relaxed and welcoming and we were invited to pop down for a glass of wine if we fancied it. Paul supplied the wine and we had an interesting time interrogating him on the story behind the house. Thanks to work, I've stayed in all sorts of hotels in lots of countries and I'm always looking for places like this - it's a real gem. We'll definitely stay here again at some point, probably with friends as a birthday celebration at Nutters restaurant along with another pamper at the day spa - obviously.
title: “Beautiful and relaxing place”

text: We stayed here for a night while visiting friends and from the moment of our arrival, Paul was incredibly friendly and welcoming. We were settled in with a glass of red and conversation in the lovely living room, and that set the tone for our entire stay! The hotel is worlds away from the usual chain fare, with fabulous antiques in every room. The room was warm, comfortable and luxurious, and had some beautiful decor in it without being overwhelming. We were welcomed back from our night with more wine, more conversation and music, and went to bed feeling relaxed and refreshed. Far and away one of the best hotels I have stayed at and a real gem.
title: “A great independent hotel”

text: We stayed at the 'Villas' on Friday 25th January, but this time with friends who had not been before. As usual we were going to 'Nutters' restaurant, this time for their 'Burn's Night' celebrations. Paul as usual greeted us warmly and we were immediately 'at home.' After a drink and catch up we went to get ready and Paul ordered a taxi to take us to the restaurant. The weather really lived up to the theme of 'Burn's Night' and we had extremely heavy snow. In fact there was a point when we thought we may be unable to get back to the 'Villas.' However we needn't have worried Paul made sure we got back and was even waiting up to let us in! The room we had was the one with a four-poster bed so were we glad to end up sleeping in it!! As always everything was excellent and of the highest standard. Breakfast was lovely with all the extra touches that make it special. Whilst we were eating and getting ready to go, our host was busy clearing snow from the driveway so that we could get our cars out! Our friends were equally impressed, and hopefully we shall all be returning in the not too distant future, but with better weather!! Helen and Peter. Room Tip: The four poster bed in the room on the top floor really makes your stay special. See more room tips
title: “Burn's Night”

text: Enjoyed a fantastic stay. The pictures do not do the hotel justice and the decoration and tastefulness of the premises is just fantastic. The owner, Paul, made us feel ever so welcome and found his company and hosting an additional and unexpected bonus. If you want to feel made completely at home, in a fantastic setting then this is the place you need to stay. We will definitely be returning soon. Russ and Lucie

text: I booked this for the 22nd December for part of my partners Xmas gift. The owner Paul was lovely as were the other staff and he greeted us with a nice glass of red so we felt very welcome. The bedroom was immaculate as was the whole hotel and we enjoyed a lovely full English on the Sunday. We will be staying there again if in the area again and would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

text: We would highly recommend The Villas Residence. A lovely boutique style guest house. Great hospitality shown from Paul and Anita, wonderful ambience, luxury bedrooms filled with antiques and immaculately clean. A real gem culminating in a delicious breakfast.
title: “East Sussex visitors”

text: From the second you arrive at The Villas Residence, you know you've made a good decision. Paul welcomes you like a long-lost friend and ensures that you are pampered throughout your stay. The spectacular house and the rooms within are like another world - like a wonderful film set made real. The bedrooms and bathrooms are immaculate and would embarrass many of the city's main name offerings. Breakfast is delicious. Lesser places might offer the run of the mill full cooked, instead Paul serves up a delicious eggs benedict. No wonder so many famous TV chefs stay here! Do yourself a favour and book here whenever you're in the Manchester region. Room Tip: All of the rooms are fantastic and Paul will help you to stay in the right one. See more room tips
title: “The perfect base from which to explore Manchester and beyond”
